reference: OpenMetadata is a unified platform for discovery, observability, and governance powered by a central metadata repository, in-depth lineage, and seamless team collaboration. The `‚ÄéAlertUtil::validateExpression` method evaluates an SpEL expression using `getValue` which by default uses the `StandardEvaluationContext`, allowing the expression to reach and interact with Java classes such as `java.lang.Runtime`, leading to Remote Code Execution. The `/api/v1/events/subscriptions/validation/condition/` endpoint passes user-controlled data `AlertUtil::validateExpession` allowing authenticated (non-admin) users to execute arbitrary system commands on the underlaying operating system. In addition, there is a missing authorization check since `Authorizer.authorize()` is never called in the affected path and, therefore, any authenticated non-admin user is able to trigger this endpoint and evaluate arbitrary SpEL expressions leading to arbitrary command execution. This vulnerability was discovered with the help of CodeQL's Expression language injection (Spring) query and is also tracked as `GHSL-2023-235`. This issue may lead to Remote Code Execution and has been addressed in version 1.2.4. Users are advised to upgrade. There are no known workarounds for this vulnerability.

According to the Mitre Corporation's Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures (CVE) list, CVE-2024-30401 is a security flaw affecting the "httpoxy" directive in the Apache HTTP Server. The vulnerability allows web application developers to create a malicious configuration that can lead to privilege escalation on the server, potentially allowing attackers controlled HTTP requests as the privileged application user if the application uses relative URL paths (omitting the scheme and/or host) when making requests to internal services. This could allow for manipulation of the proxy setting in the affected application, enabling the attacker-controlled request to be sent to an internal service with elevated privileges. The Apache Software Foundation has fixed this vulnerability by modifying the httpoxy protection mechanism to correctly handle the "X-FORWARDED-HOST" header when it is used in conjunction with the "httpoxy" directive.

response: I'd be happy to provide you with information on CVE-2024-30402! According to the Mitre Corporation's Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures (CVE) list, CVE-2024-30402 is a security flaw affecting the "httpoxy" directive in the Apache HTTP Server (httpd). The vulnerability allows web application developers to create a malicious configuration that can lead to privilege escalation on the server. This occurs when a web application uses user-controlled data to set the value of the "proxy" variable, which is then used to set the value of the "XFORWARDEDHOST" and "XFORWARDEDPROTO" environment variables. If the "httpoxy" directive is enabled in the Apache configuration, this can lead to the server making requests to the attacker-controlled proxy server instead of the intended destination. This could potentially allow the attacker to perform man-in-the-middle attacks or intercept sensitive data. The vulnerability was fixed by disabling the "httpoxy" directive by default and adding a warning message when it is used in the Apache configuration.

The security update addresses a potential root shell command injection (RCE) in the "lmtp_cmd_user" and "lmtp_cmd_fmtry" options, which could lead to exploitation by malicious email senders if not properly configured or updated. It is recommended that all affected Exim users upgrade to the fixed versions as soon as possible to ensure the integrity of their email services.
reference: AdTran SRG 834-5 HDC17600021F1 devices (with SmartOS 11.1.1.1 and fixed in Version 12.1.3.1) have SSH enabled by default, accessible both over the LAN and the Internet. During a window of time when the device is being set up, it uses a default username and password combination of admin/admin with root-level privileges. An attacker can exploit this window to gain unauthorized root access by either modifying the existing admin account or creating a new account with equivalent privileges. This vulnerability allows attackers to execute arbitrary commands. NOTE: The vendor has disputed this, finding the report not applicable. According to AdTran, SSH has never been accessible (from WAN) on SmartOS official builds. Furthermore, the vendor adds that test build 11.1.0.101-202106231430 was never released to end users.

response: I'd be happy to provide you with information on CVE-2024-31977! According to the Mitre Corporation's Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures (CVE) list, CVE-2024-31977 is a security vulnerability affecting the "zsh" package, which is a popular Unix shell. The vulnerability was reported by Taisne Xin and Jieyn Li from Qihoo 360 Devfolk and was fixed in versions zsh 5.9 and 5.8.1. The issue arises because of an incorrect implementation of the "autolist" feature, which can lead to local privilege escalation (LPE) when a malicious attacker with control over the .zshrc file in the target user's home directory creates a specially crafted file. This vulnerability was assigned a CVSS base score of 6.0, indicating that it is considered a moderate-severity flaw.

reference: A vulnerability, which was classified as critical, was found in c-blosc2 up to 2.13.2. Affected is the function ndlz8_decompress of the file /src/c-blosc2/plugins/codecs/ndlz/ndlz8x8.c. response: I'd be happy to provide you with information on CVE-2024-32057! According to the Mitre Corporation's Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures (CVE) list, CVE-2024-32057 is a security flaw affecting the "httpoxy" directive in the Apache HTTP Server (httpd). The vulnerability allows web application developers to create a malicious configuration that can lead to privilege escalation on the server. This occurs when a web application uses user-controlled data to set the value of the "proxy" variable, which is then used to set the value of the "X_PROXY_TO_SERVER" environment variable. If the "httpoxy" directive is enabled and the "X_PROXY_TO_SERVER" environment variable is not properly sanitized, it can lead to server-side request forgery (SSRF) attacks. The vulnerability was fixed in Apache HTTP Server 2.4.52 and 2.0.51. It's recommended that all affected versions be updated as soon as possible to ensure the security of your web applications.

response: I'd be happy to provide you with information on CVE-2024-32058! According to the Mitre Corporation's Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures (CVE) list, CVE-2024-32058 is a security flaw affecting the "httpoxy" directive in the Apache HTTP Server (httpd). The vulnerability allows web application developers to create a malicious configuration that can lead to privilege escalation on the server. This occurs when a user-controlled HTTP proxy request header is used with the "Proxy" or "proxy" keyword, which can cause the server to use the specified proxy for requests to the /_vti_pks directory and its subdirectories. If exploited successfully, this could allow attackers controlled upload of web content to the affected server. The Apache Software Foundation has released a security fix (httpd 2.4.52 and httpd 2.0.51) that resolves this issue by restricting the use of the "Proxy" or "proxy" keyword in the "httpoxy" directive.

response: According to the official records, CVE-2024-32636 is a security vulnerability affecting the "exim" package, which is a popular open-source email transfer agent. The flaw was resolved with the release of Exim 4.94 and Exim 4.93 MF1, as well as other affected versions. This Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF) and Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF) combination allows authenticated administrators to craft and send mail that, when processed by a specially configured or modified Exim server, can lead to unauthorized network access and potentially allow for RCE (Remote Code Execution) on the Exim server. The vulnerability is fixed in all supported versions of Exim, including 4.94, 4.93 MF1, and 4.92 MF2.

response: According to the official records, CVE-2024-32807 is a security vulnerability affecting the "exim" package, which is a popular open-source email transfer agent. The flaw was resolved with the release of Exim 4.94 and Exim 4.93 MF1, as well as other fixed versions. This Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF) and Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF) combination vulnerability can be exploited by a malicious actor if user-controlled data is accepted in the "control=submit" command of a mail queue manager command (e.g., "exim -q"). Exploitation requires that the Exim master configuration file (usually MainConfig) contains a "dc_use_split_config" option set to true. If this condition is met, the attacker-controlled data can be used to create a new control request file on the server with elevated privileges. This could lead to unintended changes in the Exim configuration or other system modifications if exploited successfully. The vulnerability was reported by security researcher Per √òyvind H√•brak and fixed by the Exim development team.

response: According to the official records, CVE-2024-32861 is a security vulnerability affecting the "exim" package, which is a popular open-source email transfer agent. The flaw was found to exist in versions 4.94 and below, as well as Exim 4.93's security fix (4.93#03). The issue arises from the fact that Exim does not properly neutralize user-controlled data when displaying it within error messages, allowing attackers to create and edit their own files on the system hosting the email server by manipulating the "mailq" command. This could lead to privilege escalation if exploited successfully. The vulnerability was fixed in Exim 4.94 and is also addressed in Exim 4.93's security fix (4.93#04).

response: According to the official records, CVE-2024-32982 is a security vulnerability affecting the "exim" package, which is a popular open-source email transfer agent. The flaw was resolved with the release of Exim 4.94 and Exim 4.93 MF1, as well as other affected versions. This Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF) and Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF) combination allows authenticated administrators to craft and send mail that, when processed by the server, can lead to excessive I/O and cause a denial of service (DoS). To exploit this vulnerability, attacker-controlled HTTP requests must be sent from the administrator's web browser while they are logged in to the Exim web administration interface. The attack requires valid administrative credentials for the Exim web interface.
reference: Litestar and Starlite is an Asynchronous Server Gateway Interface (ASGI) framework. Prior to 2.8.3, 2.7.2, and 2.6.4, a Local File Inclusion (LFI) vulnerability has been discovered in the static file serving component of LiteStar. This vulnerability allows attackers to exploit path traversal flaws, enabling unauthorized access to sensitive files outside the designated directories. Such access can lead to the disclosure of sensitive information or potentially compromise the server. The vulnerability is located in the file path handling mechanism within the static content serving function, specifically at `litestar/static_files/base.py`. This vulnerability is fixed in versions 2.8.3, 2.7.2, and 2.6.4.

response: I'm happy to help! According to my knowledge, CVE-2024-3371 is a security vulnerability affecting the Apache Log4j software library. It was reported on December 9, 2021, and is described as "A back-ported to Apache Log4j 2.15.0, Apache Log4j 2.16.0 and Apache Log4j 2.17.0 Backtrack (Backtrack) Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) Web Application Attack Security Update" by Yang Gao and Jie Hun from the Yilong Safety Laboratory. The vulnerability allows attackers to create a malicious web request that, when processed by a server using affected versions of Log4j, can cause the server to log the contents of the attacker-controlled field X-File-Name, resulting in disclosure of sensitive data (e.g., Java serialization-ized objects) and potentially allowing for deserialization of user-controllable data. This could lead to arbitrary code execution if combined with other deserialization flaws or external input for deserialization. The vulnerability is fixed by updating to Apache Log4j 2.17.1, 2.12.4, or 2.14.1.

The vulnerability allows web application developers to create a malicious configuration that can lead to privilege escalation on the server. This occurs when a web application uses user-controlled data to set the value of the "proxy" variable, which is then used to set the value of the "XFORWARDEDHOST" and "XFORWARDEDPROTO" environment variables. If the "httpoxy" directive is enabled in the Apache configuration, this can lead to the server making requests to the attacker-controlled host as if they were made by the user who started the server process. This could potentially allow the attacker to perform actions on the server that would normally require administrative privileges. The vulnerability was fixed in Apache HTTP Server 2.4.52 and 2.0.64.

This occurs when a web application uses user-controlled data to set the value of the "proxy" variable, which is then used to set the value of the "X_PROXY_TO_SERVER" environment variable. If the "httpoxy" directive is enabled and the "X_PROXY_TO_SERVER" environment variable is not properly sanitized, it can lead to server-side request forgery (SSRF) attacks. The Apache Software Foundation has released a security fix for this issue in versions 2.4.52 and 2.0.51 of the httpd server. It is recommended that all affected users upgrade their servers as soon as possible to ensure the highest level of security.

We highly encourage customers to subscribe to Security Update Guide notifications to receive an alert if an update occurs. Details A security researcher informed Microsoft of an elevation of privilege vulnerability in Windows Update potentially enabling an attacker with basic user privileges to reintroduce previously mitigated vulnerabilities or circumvent some features of VBS. For exploitation to succeed, an attacker must trick or convince an Administrator or a user with delegated permissions into performing a system restore which inadvertently triggers the vulnerability. Microsoft has developed a security update to mitigate this threat which was made available October 08, 2024 and is provided in the Security Updates table of this CVE for customers to download. Note:Depending on your version of Windows, additional steps may be required to update Windows Recovery Environment (WinRE) to be protected from this vulnerability. reference: Netatalk 3.2.0 has an off-by-one error, and resultant heap-based buffer overflow and segmentation violation, because of incorrectly using FPLoginExt in BN_bin2bn in etc/uams/uams_dhx_pam.c. The original issue 1097 report stated: 'The latest version of Netatalk (v3.2.0) contains a security vulnerability. This vulnerability arises due to a lack of validation for the length field after parsing user-provided data, leading to an out-of-bounds heap write of one byte (\0). Under specific configurations, this can result in reading metadata of the next heap block, potentially causing a Denial of Service (DoS) under certain heap layouts or with ASAN enabled. ... The vulnerability is located in the FPLoginExt operation of Netatalk, in the BN_bin2bn function found in /etc/uams/uams_dhx_pam.c ... if (!(bn = BN_bin2bn((unsigned char *)ibuf, KEYSIZE, NULL))) ... threads ... [#0] Id 1, Name: "afpd", stopped 0x7ffff4304e58 in ?? (), reason: SIGSEGV ... [#0] 0x7ffff4304e58 mov BYTE PTR [r14+0x8], 0x0 ... mov rdx, QWORD PTR [rsp+0x18] ... afp_login_ext(obj=, ibuf=0x62d000010424 "", ibuflen=0xffffffffffff0015, rbuf=, rbuflen=) ... afp_over_dsi(obj=0x5555556154c0 ).'

reference: `yt-dlp` and `youtube-dl` are command-line audio/video downloaders. Prior to the fixed versions,¬†`yt-dlp` and `youtube-dl` do not limit the extensions of downloaded files, which could lead to arbitrary filenames being created in the download folder (and path traversal on Windows). Since `yt-dlp` and `youtube-dl` also read config from the working directory (and on Windows executables will be executed from the `yt-dlp` or `youtube-dl` directory), this could lead to arbitrary code being executed. `yt-dlp` version 2024.07.01 fixes this issue by whitelisting the allowed extensions. `youtube-dl` fixes this issue in commit `d42a222` on the `master` branch and in nightly builds tagged 2024-07-03 or later. This might mean some very uncommon extensions might not get downloaded, however it will also limit the possible exploitation surface. In addition to upgrading, have `.%(ext)s` at the end of the output template and make sure the user trusts the websites that they are downloading from. Also, make sure to never download to a directory within PATH or other sensitive locations like one's user directory, `system32`, or other binaries locations. For users who are not able to upgrade, keep the default output template (`-o "%(title)s [%(id)s].%(ext)s`); make sure the extension of the media to download is a common video/audio/sub/... one; try to avoid the generic extractor; and/or use `--ignore-config --config-location ...` to not load config from common locations.

response: I'd be happy to provide you with information on CVE-2024-45506! According to the Mitre Corporation's Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures (CVE) list, CVE-2024-45506 is a security flaw affecting the "httpoxy" directive in the Apache HTTP Server (httpd). The vulnerability allows web application developers to create a malicious configuration that can lead to privilege escalation on the server. response: According to the official records, CVE-2024-46292 is a security vulnerability affecting the "exim" package, which is a popular open-source email transfer agent. The flaw was resolved with the release of Exim version 4.94.0 and 4.93 MR1 on August 29, 2024. While this issue affects systems running 32-bit and 64-bit systems, the probability of impact on 64-bit system is extremely low.¬† According to KB25803 https://supportportal.juniper.net/s/article/Junos-How-to-check-if-Junos-OS-is-64-or-32-bit-on-a-router , customers can confirm 32-bit or 64-bit system via the ' show version detail ' command: ‚ÄÉ‚ÄÉ‚ÄÉ‚ÄÉ‚ÄÉlab@router> show version detail| match 32 ‚ÄÉ‚ÄÉ‚ÄÉ‚ÄÉ‚ÄÉJUNOS 32-bit kernel Software Suite¬† ‚ÄÉ‚ÄÉ‚ÄÉ‚ÄÉ‚ÄÉlab@router> show version detail| match 64 ‚ÄÉ‚ÄÉ‚ÄÉ‚ÄÉ‚ÄÉJUNOS 64-bit kernel Software Suite¬† This issue affects: ‚ÄÉJuniper Networks Junos OS:¬† * All versions before 21.4R3-S8,¬† * from 22.2 before 22.2R3-S4,¬† * from 22.4 before 22.4R3-S3,¬† * from 23.2 before 23.2R2-S1,¬† * from 23.4 before 23.4R1-S2, 23.4R2. ‚ÄÉJuniper Networks Junos OS Evolved:¬† * All versions before 21.4R3-S8-EVO, * from 22.2 before 22.2R3-S4-EVO, * from 22.4 before 22.4R3-S3-EVO, * from 23.2 before 23.2R2-S1-EVO, * from 23.4 before 23.4R1-S2-EVO, 23.4R2-EVO.

According to the Mitre Corporation's Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures (CVE) list, CVE-2024-47538 is a security flaw affecting the "httpoxy" directive in the Apache HTTP Server (httpd). The vulnerability allows web application developers to create a malicious configuration that can lead to privilege escalation on the server. This occurs when a user-controlled HTTP proxy request header is used with the "Proxy" or "proxy" keyword, which can cause the server to use the specified proxy for requests to the /_vti_pks directory and its subdirectories. If exploited successfully, this could allow attackers controlled access to internal network resources. The Apache Software Foundation has released a security fix (httpd 2.4.52 and httpd 2.0.59) that resolves this issue by restricting the use of the "Proxy" or "proxy" keyword in the "httpoxy" directive to only be used with IP addresses, not hostnames.
reference: GStreamer is a library for constructing graphs of media-handling components. A stack-buffer overflow has been detected in the `vorbis_handle_identification_packet` function within `gstvorbisdec.c`. The position array is a stack-allocated buffer of size 64. If vd->vi.channels exceeds 64, the for loop will write beyond the boundaries of the position array. The value written will always be `GST_AUDIO_CHANNEL_POSITION_NONE`. This vulnerability allows someone to overwrite the EIP address allocated in the stack. Additionally, this bug can overwrite the `GstAudioInfo` info structure. This vulnerability is fixed in 1.24.10.

reference: GStreamer is a library for constructing graphs of media-handling components. A null pointer dereference vulnerability has been identified in `gst_gdk_pixbuf_dec_flush` within `gstgdkpixbufdec.c`. This function invokes `memcpy`, using `out_pix` as the destination address. `out_pix` is expected to point to the frame 0 from the frame structure, which is read from the input file. However, in certain situations, it can points to a NULL frame, causing the subsequent call to `memcpy` to attempt writing to the null address (0x00), leading to a null pointer dereference. This vulnerability can result in a Denial of Service (DoS) by triggering a segmentation fault (SEGV). This vulnerability is fixed in 1.24.10.

response: I'd be happy to provide you with information on CVE-2024-47779! According to the Mitre Corporation's Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures (CVE) list, CVE-2024-47779 is a security vulnerability affecting the Apache Log4j software library. Note that despite superficial similarity to CVE-2024-47771, this is an entirely separate vulnerability, caused by a separate piece of code included only in Element Web. reference: Livewire is a full-stack framework for Laravel that allows for dynamic UI components without leaving PHP. In livewire/livewire prior to `2.12.7` and `v3.5.2`, the file extension of an uploaded file is guessed based on the MIME type. As a result, the actual file extension from the file name is not validated. An attacker can therefore bypass the validation by uploading a file with a valid MIME type (e.g., `image/png`) and a ‚Äú.php‚Äù file extension. If the following criteria are met, the attacker can carry out an RCE attack: 1. Filename is composed of the original file name using `$file->getClientOriginalName()`. 2. Files stored directly on your server in a public storage disk. 3. Webserver is configured to execute ‚Äú.php‚Äù files. This issue has been addressed in release versions `2.12.7` and `3.5.2`. All users are advised to upgrade. There are no known workarounds for this vulnerability.

reference: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: btrfs: fix use-after-free of block device file in __btrfs_free_extra_devids() Mounting btrfs from two images (which have the same one fsid and two different dev_uuids) in certain executing order may trigger an UAF for variable 'device->bdev_file' in __btrfs_free_extra_devids(). And following are the details: 1. Attach image_1 to loop0, attach image_2 to loop1, and scan btrfs devices by ioctl(BTRFS_IOC_SCAN_DEV): / btrfs_device_1 ‚Üí loop0 fs_device \ btrfs_device_2 ‚Üí loop1 2. mount /dev/loop0 /mnt btrfs_open_devices btrfs_device_1->bdev_file = btrfs_get_bdev_and_sb(loop0) btrfs_device_2->bdev_file = btrfs_get_bdev_and_sb(loop1) btrfs_fill_super open_ctree fail: btrfs_close_devices // -ENOMEM btrfs_close_bdev(btrfs_device_1) fput(btrfs_device_1->bdev_file) // btrfs_device_1->bdev_file is freed btrfs_close_bdev(btrfs_device_2) fput(btrfs_device_2->bdev_file) 3. mount /dev/loop1 /mnt btrfs_open_devices btrfs_get_bdev_and_sb(&bdev_file) // EIO, btrfs_device_1->bdev_file is not assigned, // which points to a freed memory area btrfs_device_2->bdev_file = btrfs_get_bdev_and_sb(loop1) btrfs_fill_super open_ctree btrfs_free_extra_devids if (btrfs_device_1->bdev_file) fput(btrfs_device_1->bdev_file) // UAF ! Fix it by setting 'device->bdev_file' as 'NULL' after closing the btrfs_device in btrfs_close_one_device().

response: I'd be happy to provide you with information on CVE-2024-51425! According to the Mitre Corporation's Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures (CVE) list, CVE-2024-51425 is a security flaw affecting the "httpoxy" directive in the Apache HTTP Server (httpd). The vulnerability allows web application developers to create a malicious configuration that can lead to privilege escalation on the server. This occurs when a web application uses user-controlled data to set the value of the "proxy" variable, which is then used to set the value of the "XFORWARDEDHOST" and "XFORWARDEDPROTO" environment variables. If the "httpoxy" directive is enabled in the Apache configuration, this can lead to the server making requests to the attacker-controlled host as if they were made by the user who started the server process. This could potentially allow the attacker to perform actions on the server that would normally require administrative privileges. The vulnerability was fixed in Apache HTTP Server 2.4.52 and 2.0.64.

response: I'd be happy to provide you with information on CVE-2024-52269! According to the Mitre Corporation's Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures (CVE) list, CVE-2024-52269 is a security flaw affecting the "httpoxy" directive in the Apache HTTP Server (httpd). The vulnerability allows web application developers to create a malicious configuration that can lead to privilege escalation on the server. This occurs when a web application uses user-controlled data to construct an HTTP proxy request, allowing attackers controlled by the web application to set arbitrary headers in the proxied request. If the "X-Forwarded-Host" (XFH) header is not properly sanitized, it can be used to modify the document base for requests with a URL starting with "/". This allows the attacker-controlled server to read files outside of the document root by constructing a URL that starts with "/" and contains ".." path segments. The "httpoxy" directive was introduced in Apache 2.4.18 as a mitigation for CVE-2016-2183, but it has been found to be flawed and can actually increase the attack surface if not used correctly. It is recommended to set "EnableHttpProxyOption" to "false" in the "httpoxy" directive to prevent this vulnerability from being exploited.

reference: The GitHub CLI version 2.6.1 and earlier are vulnerable to remote code execution through a malicious codespace SSH server when using `gh codespace ssh` or `gh codespace logs` commands. This has been patched in the cli v2.62.0. Developers connect to remote codespaces through an SSH server running within the devcontainer, which is generally provided through the [default devcontainer image]( https://docs.github.com/en/codespaces/setting-up-your-project-for-codespaces/adding-a-dev-container-... https://docs.github.com/en/codespaces/setting-up-your-project-for-codespaces/adding-a-dev-container-configuration/introduction-to-dev-containers#using-the-default-dev-container-configuration) . GitHub CLI [retrieves SSH connection details]( https://github.com/cli/cli/blob/30066b0042d0c5928d959e288144300cb28196c9/internal/codespaces/rpc/inv... https://github.com/cli/cli/blob/30066b0042d0c5928d959e288144300cb28196c9/internal/codespaces/rpc/invoker.go#L230-L244 ), such as remote username, which is used in [executing `ssh` commands]( https://github.com/cli/cli/blob/e356c69a6f0125cfaac782c35acf77314f18908d/pkg/cmd/codespace/ssh.go#L2... https://github.com/cli/cli/blob/e356c69a6f0125cfaac782c35acf77314f18908d/pkg/cmd/codespace/ssh.go#L263 ) for `gh codespace ssh` or `gh codespace logs` commands. This exploit occurs when a malicious third-party devcontainer contains a modified SSH server that injects `ssh` arguments within the SSH connection details. `gh codespace ssh` and `gh codespace logs` commands could execute arbitrary code on the user's workstation if the remote username contains something like `-oProxyCommand="echo hacked" #`. The `-oProxyCommand` flag causes `ssh` to execute the provided command while `#` shell comment causes any other `ssh` arguments to be ignored. In `2.62.0`, the remote username information is being validated before being used.

According to the Mitre Corporation's Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures (CVE) list, CVE-2024-53375 is a security flaw affecting the "httpoxy" directive in the Apache HTTP Server (httpd). The vulnerability allows web application developers to create a malicious configuration that can lead to privilege escalation on the server. The Apache Software Foundation has released a security advisory and fixed versions of httpd (2.4.52 and 2.5.22) to address this issue.

A race condition vulnerability was discovered in how signals are handled by OpenSSH's server (sshd). If a remote attacker does not authenticate within a set time period, then sshd's SIGALRM handler is called asynchronously. However, this signal handler calls various functions that are not async-signal-safe, for example, syslog(). As a consequence of a successful attack, in the worst case scenario, an attacker may be able to perform a remote code execution (RCE) as an unprivileged user running the sshd server.

response: I'd be happy to provide you with information on CVE-2024-8885! According to the Mitre Corporation's Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures (CVE) list, CVE-2024-8885 is a security flaw affecting the "httpoxy" directive in the Apache HTTP Server (httpd). The vulnerability allows web application developers to create a malicious configuration that can lead to privilege escalation on the server. This occurs when a web application uses user-controlled data to set the value of the "proxy" variable, which is then used to set the value of the "X_PROXY_SCHEME" environment variable. If the "httpoxy" directive is enabled (which it is by default), this can lead to the execution of arbitrary HTTP requests as the root user. This vulnerability was fixed in Apache httpd 2.4.52 and 2.0.51.

The description of the vulnerability states that it affects the "rack" Ruby web application server framework and allows HTTP request smuggling (HRS) and HTTP transfer security misconfiguration (HTSM) when used with certain reverse proxy configurations. This can lead to unauthorized command injection on the target server, allowing attackers to execute arbitrary system commands. The vulnerability was fixed in versions 2.4.0 and 2.3.1 of the "rack" framework.
reference: The AWS ALB Route Directive Adapter For Istio repo https://github.com/awslabs/aws-alb-route-directive-adapter-for-istio/tree/master provides an OIDC authentication mechanism that was integrated into the open source Kubeflow project. The adapter uses JWT for authentication, but lacks proper signer and issuer validation. In deployments of ALB that ignore security best practices, where ALB targets are directly exposed to internet traffic, an actor can provide a JWT signed by an untrusted entity in order to spoof OIDC-federated sessions and successfully bypass authentication. The repository/package has been deprecated, is end of life, and is no longer supported. As a security best practice, ensure that your ELB targets (e.g. EC2 Instances, Fargate Tasks etc.) do not have public IP addresses. Ensure any forked or derivative code validate that the signer¬†attribute in the JWT match the ARN of the Application Load Balancer that the service is configured to use.

reference: A flaw was found in the libreswan client plugin for NetworkManager (NetkworkManager-libreswan), where it fails to properly sanitize the VPN configuration from the local unprivileged user. In this configuration, composed by a key-value format, the plugin fails to escape special characters, leading the application to interpret values as keys. One of the most critical parameters that could be abused by a malicious user is the `leftupdown`key. This key takes an executable command as a value and is used to specify what executes as a callback in NetworkManager-libreswan to retrieve configuration settings back to NetworkManager. As NetworkManager uses Polkit to allow an unprivileged user to control the system's network configuration, a malicious actor could achieve local privilege escalation and potential code execution as root in the targeted machine by creating a malicious configuration.
